qas.question: How much of the island was controlled by Turks after international pressure led to a ceasefire?
How many Greek Cypriots had been displaced from their homes?
How many Turkish Cypriots moved into areas that were under Turkish control?
In what year did the US impose an arms embargo on Turkey?
Why did the US impose an arms embargo on Turkey?

answers.text: using American-supplied equipment during the Turkish invasion of Cyprus in 1974

context: International pressure led to a ceasefire, and by then <a0_0>37%<a0_0/> of the island had been taken over by the Turks and <a1_0>180,000<a1_0/> Greek Cypriots had been evicted from their homes in the north. At the same time, around <a2_0>50,000<a2_0/> Turkish Cypriots moved to the areas under the control of the Turkish Forces and settled in the properties of the displaced Greek Cypriots. Among a variety of sanctions against Turkey, in mid-<a3_0>1975<a3_0/> the US Congress imposed an arms embargo on Turkey for <a4_0>using American-supplied equipment during the Turkish invasion of Cyprus in 1974<a4_0/>. There are 1,534 Greek Cypriots and 502 Turkish Cypriots missing as a result of the fighting.
